author: Chaitanya Prakash
title: Trevor Bauer's MLB redemption bid falling flat with the worst ERA in Japanese baseball, per MLB Insider
text:
') > -1) { addClass($('.section-container'), 'pill-tag'); } Follow Us Share 0 Discuss 0 Discuss What's your opinion? Trevor Bauer’s MLB redemption bid falling flat with the worst ERA in Japanese baseball, per MLB Insider Discuss Now Trevor Bauer’s MLB redemption bid falling flat with the worst ERA in Japanese baseball, per MLB Insider - Source: Imagn Former Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Trevor Bauer has been trying to revive his career by finding a way back to the major leagues. However, things are not going to plan for the veteran pitcher in Japan.
Ad Bauer, who last pitched in the MLB for the Dodgers in 2021, is playing in Japan in his second stint in the Nippon Professional Baseball (NPB). However, it has been a contrasting performance from his first stint in 2023 as the former Cy Young winner has been one of the worst pitchers in NPB this season.
The Yokohama Baystars demoted Bauer to the minors after underwhelming performances. The former All-Star pitcher is doing the rounds on social media after surrendering a 594-foot home run, one of the longest in NPB history, on his return from the minors against the Hiroshima Carp on Wednesday.
Ad Trending •
70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now Expand Tweet Ad Trevor Bauer pitched six innings on the night, conceding four earned runs with five strikeouts. Hiroshima registered a 4-3 win against the BayStars, with all their runs coming against the former Dodgers pitcher.
The former Cy Young winner pitched for the BayStars in 2023 after he served a 182-game suspension from MLB. Bauer pitched in Mexico for the Diablos Los Rojos and was named the Pitcher of the Year after helping them to the league championship.
Ad He went undefeated in the regular season with a 10-0 record and a 2.48 ERA, striking out 120 batters in 83.1 innings. He had 32 strikeouts with a 1.67 ERA in the postseason last year.
Trevor Bauer makes unwanted records against Hiroshima Trevor Bauer's outing against Hiroshima was a bittersweet evening for the former Dodgers pitcher. While Bauer became the fastest Central League pitcher to register 100 strikeouts, his ERA climbed to 4.17 for the season, the highest by any NPB starter.
The veteran pitcher hoped for a return to major league baseball after his stellar season in Mexico last season, but no MLB team took a chance on the veteran ace. His continued struggles in Japan are further hampering his chances of a potential MLB return in the future.

Chaitanya Prakash is an editor who covers US Sports at Sportskeeda. His first brush with sportswriting was in 2012 when the greatest football manager of all time, Sir Alex Ferguson, bid farewell to the beautiful game.
Although having started out professionally as a cricket writer in 2022, Chaitanya's curiosity and indiscriminate interest in all sports in general eventually introduced him to America's favorite pastime.
While Chaitanya's favorite player from the current crop is the dynamic Venezuelan Ronald Acuna Jr., his all-time favorite, however, is Pedro Martinez, for his self-belief and consistency. He also rates Jose Bautista's iconic bat flip in 2015 as his favorite moment in baseball history.
Chaitanya specializes in reporting on technical aspects of the game or analyzing patterns behind specific plays. He also likes pondering over players' self-assessments following the conclusion of a game as it helps him get an idea of how they think about the sport in general.
When not cheering for his favorites across sports, Chaitanya likes being transported to the past through a good war documentary or a historical documentary in general.

author: Jay Postrado
title: Saints’ All-Pro Ryan Ramczyk mulling retirement amid persistent knee issues
text: Ryan Ramczyk's professional football career is in jeopardy. He was diagnosed with a cartilage defect in his knee which could be career-threartening. The [New Orleans Saints](/nfl/new-orleans-saints) tackle knew that this would cast a shadow of doubt in his hopes of having a long NFL tenure. This prompted him to keep thinking about his future. If he does choose to retire, a final showdown against Taylor Heinicke's Atlanta Falcons awaits him. There has [not been any decision](https://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/39199666/saints-ryan-ramczyk-uncertain-nfl-future-due-cartilage-defect) to come [out of Ryan Ramczyk](https://clutchpoints.com/saints-news-all-pro-tackle-ryan-ramczyk-gets-96-million-extension) but he has unveiled his thoughts on it, via Katherine Terrell of ESPN. “I feel like I'm not done yet. I feel like I still want to play and feel like I'm still passionate about the game. When you think about it like that, my mind frame is, ‘I want to play, and I want to keep doing it, so what can I do to get better, to not have this happen in-season?,'” was the [revelation that the Saints](https://clutchpoints.com/saints-most-blame-week-16-loss-vs-rams) left tackle made amid his injury struggles. These wishes for a longer career look bleak for the Saints' big man. He faces a future filled with knee issues because of the injury. If he spends more time on the gridiron, the situation could get worse. Moreover, a realization hit him this season. After battling with this pain for the past years, all he could say was, “This year it's bugged me a little bit more than it has in the past. At some point, I just couldn't play anymore.” Will he end his tenure and career during the Saints' game against Taylor Heinicke's Falcons?

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Progeria Influencer Beandri Booysen Who “Was A Voice And A Symbol Of Awareness” Has Passed Away At 19
text:
By Colleen Dilthey Thomas ,
22 minutes ago Just a week before Christmas, a popular teenage social media influencer has died. Beandri Booysen, 19, died from complications of progeria , a rare genetic disorder that causes a person to age rapidly. She died less than a month after her 19th birthday.
@bb_unique_2005 #angel #loved WE ALREADY MISS YOU SO MUCH #fyp
♬ original sound – Phil Wickham – Phil Wickham Beandri Booysen’s Family Shared News Of Her Passing Her mother, Bea Booysen, released a statement in the Beandri, Our Inspiration Faceboo k group announcing her daughter’s passing.
She wrote in part, “It is with deep sadness that we announce the passing of Beandri Booysen, one of South Africa’s most beloved and inspirational young women. Beandri was not only known for her sparkling personality and infectious laugh, but was also the last surviving person in South Africa to live with Progeria – a rare genetic condition that causes children to age early.”
Followers and loved ones shared condolences with the family.
One wrote, “What a sad moment for South Africa, May her soul find rest in the Lord and may the Lord comfort the family
“Rest in peace dear Beandri… God’s warrior to the end. To mom, dad, brother, family and loved ones, lots of strength in this sad time, may God hold you all tightly in His arms of comfort. We carry you in our hearts,” a follower shared.
Another wrote, “Rest in Peace my beautiful BB. You were truly an inspiration for me and I loved you unbelievably much my BB. Jesus dances with your baby in His arms on His doorstep. My deepest sympathy to Bb’s parents and loved ones.”
According to the Progeria Research Foundation , before her death, “Beandri just finished her Child Psychology studies” and was working on her life coach studies so she could help those who were dealing with emotional trauma and bullying.
The progeria community will remember Beandri Booysen for her work educating others and her zest for life. May she rest in peace.
This story’s featured image can be found here .
The post Progeria Influencer Beandri Booysen Who “Was A Voice And A Symbol Of Awareness” Has Passed Away At 19 appeared first on InspireMore .
